Return Data.recommended_pathway: High-risk STEMI protocol with primary PCI and dual antiplatelet therapy
decision_steps: Administer aspirin 325mg and clopidogrel 600mg loading dose
Initiate heparin anticoagulation (avoid warfarin due to allergy)
Perform primary percutaneous coronary intervention within 90 minutes
Monitor for complications and adjust medications for renal impairment
alternative_options: Fibrinolytic therapy if PCI unavailable within time window
Prasugrel instead of clopidogrel if no bleeding risk
Bivalirudin anticoagulation as alternative to heparin
Return Data.evidence_level: Class I recommendation, Level of Evidence A
Return Data.next_decision_point: Post-PCI risk stratification and discharge planning within 24-48 hours
